results.raw_content:
Vy, the AI-powered computer interface of the future | Vercept

===============

Back to Home

Join Our Team
=============

We're a stealth startup working on building out the next generation of AI applications. We're looking for exceptional people to join our team.

### Founding Research Scientist

•Seattle, WA

As a **Founding Research Scientist at Vercept**, you'll be at the forefront of advancing AI for real-world applications.

### Member of Technical Staff

•Seattle, WA

As a **Member of Technical Staff at Vercept**, you'll have the flexibility to shape your role based on your interests and strengths.

### Founding Full-Stack Engineer

•Seattle, WA

As a **Founding Full-Stack Engineer** at Vercept, you'll be **building the core AI platform** that powers our products.

### Founding Frontend Engineer / UX Designer

•Seattle, WA

As our **first frontend / UX Designer**, you will shape the **end-to-end experience** of our AI-powered products, ensuring they are **intuitive, engaging, and impactful**.

### Social Media Marketing Intern

•Seattle, WA

As a **Social Media Marketing Intern** at Vercept, you'll help us build our brand presence and connect with audiences across multiple social media platforms.

For other inquiries, email[hiring@vercept.com](mailto:hiring@vercept.com)

A Singapore Government Agency Website How to identify

Official website links end with .gov.sg

Government agencies communicate via .gov.sg websites (e.g. go.gov.sg/open).[Trusted websites](https://www.gov.sg/trusted-sites#govsites)

Secure websites use HTTPS

Look for a **lock** () or https:// as an added precaution. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.

Government officials will never ask you to transfer money or disclose bank log-in details over a phone call.

Back to Home

Join Our Team
=============

We're a stealth startup working on building out the next generation of AI applications. We're looking for exceptional people to join our team.

### Founding Research Scientist

•Seattle, WA

As a **Founding Research Scientist at Vercept**, you'll be at the forefront of advancing AI for real-world applications.

### Member of Technical Staff

•Seattle, WA

As a **Member of Technical Staff at Vercept**, you'll have the flexibility to shape your role based on your interests and strengths.

### Founding Full-Stack Engineer

•Seattle, WA

As a **Founding Full-Stack Engineer** at Vercept, you'll be **building the core AI platform** that powers our products.

### Founding Frontend Engineer / UX Designer

•Seattle, WA

As our **first frontend / UX Designer**, you will shape the **end-to-end experience** of our AI-powered products, ensuring they are **intuitive, engaging, and impactful**.

### Social Media Marketing Intern

•Seattle, WA

As a **Social Media Marketing Intern** at Vercept, you'll help us build our brand presence and connect with audiences across multiple social media platforms.

For other inquiries, email[hiring@vercept.com](mailto:hiring@vercept.com)

summary:
**1. Brief Overview:**  
The web content is a careers page for Vercept, a stealth startup focused on developing next-generation AI applications. The company is recruiting for several key roles in Seattle, WA, across technical, scientific, design, and marketing disciplines.

**2. Key Points from the URL ([vercept.com/careers](https://vercept.com/careers)):**
- **Company Focus:** Vercept is developing advanced AI-powered computer interfaces and applications for real-world use.  
- **Open Positions:**  
  - **Founding Research Scientist:** Leading AI advancements for practical applications.
  - **Member of Technical Staff:** Flexible technical role, adaptable to candidate strengths and interests.
  - **Founding Full-Stack Engineer:** Responsible for building the core AI platform that powers company products.
  - **Founding Frontend Engineer / UX Designer:** First hire in this area; responsible for crafting the entire user experience of AI products.
  - **Social Media Marketing Intern:** Role focused on developing Vercept’s brand and social media presence.
- **Location:** All jobs are based in Seattle, WA.
- **Contact:** Interested applicants can reach out via a provided hiring email.

**3. Notable Patterns or Themes:**
- **Founding Roles:** Most positions are labeled as “founding,” suggesting early involvement in the startup with potential for significant impact and influence on company direction.
- **Emphasis on AI:** All roles are tied closely to developing, designing, or promoting AI products, reflecting the company’s commitment to AI innovation.
- **Team Flexibility and Growth:** There's a flexible approach for technical staff, allowing team members to shape roles based on their expertise and interests.
- **User Experience and Engagement:** A key theme is building not just technology, but products that are intuitive and engaging, supported by the specific callout for a UX designer.
- **Startup Culture:** The page reflects a typical startup environment—stealth mode, foundational roles, interdisciplinary recruitment, and growth potential.

**Summary:**  
Vercept, a stealth AI startup in Seattle, is recruiting for foundational positions across research, engineering, UX, and marketing to build advanced AI-powered interfaces and applications. The company offers flexible, impactful roles emphasizing innovation, product usability, and brand building.

summary:
1. Brief Overview:
The content comes from the Built In Seattle jobs page, focusing on tech and startup job opportunities in Seattle, WA. It lists various job openings from multiple companies, primarily in the technology sector, highlighting positions across different specialties such as operations, communications, analytics, machine learning, software engineering, product management, and security.

2. Key Points from Content:
- The page features job listings from well-known tech companies, including CoreWeave, Remitly, Snap Inc., Atlassian, Chewy, John Deere, SoFi, Anduril, and others.
- Job roles vary widely, from People Operations Partner, Vice President of Global Communications, Manager of Operations Analytics, to Senior Principal Machine Learning Engineer, Staff Software Engineer in Machine Learning Infrastructure, and Product Manager in Content Quality.
- Highlighted featured jobs from top companies include Principal Data Scientist (AI) at Atlassian, Software Engineer II at Chewy, Senior Embedded Security Engineer at John Deere, Senior Staff Engineer in Cloud Platform at SoFi, Senior Robotics Software Engineer (UAV) at Anduril, and a Security Engineer focused on Mergers & Acquisitions.
- Most job roles target mid to senior-level professionals in highly specialized tech and operational roles.
- Company logos accompany each job listing, indicating branding and providing quick visual recognition.

3. Notable Patterns or Themes:
- Strong emphasis on advanced tech roles related to AI, machine learning, cloud computing, robotics, and security.
- Diversity in job function coverage, including operations, management, engineering, and data science, suggesting a comprehensive array of tech ecosystem opportunities in Seattle.
- Presence of both established tech giants and emerging startups, reflecting Seattle’s dynamic and rich tech job market.
- Leadership and senior roles are prominently featured, indicating opportunities for experienced professionals.
- The combination of engineering roles and operational/strategic roles highlights the balance between technical innovation and business operations within the tech sector in Seattle.

Overall, this content showcases a robust job market in Seattle for tech professionals, especially those specializing in AI, machine learning, software development, and strategic operational roles within prominent and rising tech firms.

# Mayor Harrell Issues Executive Order to Improve the Accessibility of City Resources and Information

|  |  |  |  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| |  |  | | --- | --- | | |  | | --- | | Office of the Mayor logo - press release version | | | |  |  | | --- | --- | | Press ReleaseFor Immediate Release **Contact Information** Ben Dalgetty Email: ben.dalgetty@seattle.gov   |  | | --- | |  |  Mayor Harrell Issues Executive Order to Improve the Accessibility of City Resources and Information **Seattle**– Today, Mayor Bruce Harrell issued an Executive Order to improve accessibility of information through a One Seattle Community Communications Strategy. The strategy includes the creation of the Seattle’s first plain language plan and new approaches to make information and services more accessible to everyone, including people with disabilities and those with limited English. The strategy will support new federal accessibility standards and help prepare the city for the FIFA World Cup in 2026 when Seattle will welcome fans from all over the world.  “Clear and accessible public information is a core responsibility of government. Whether it’s emergency updates, navigation around town, resources to help people pay a bill or start a business, or news on a neighborhood program, this effort will make it easier for people to get the information they need to use City services,” said **Mayor Harrell**. “Our administration is committed to advancing good governance and meeting people where they are. Too often, dense, difficult, and frankly indecipherable language can be a barrier to accessing government services. As a City, we can and must do better to reach all of our communities.”  The Executive Order launches three different projects as part of the One Seattle Community Communications Strategy:   * **Digital Accessibility** – The City’s Information Technology department will lead efforts to ensure that digital communications and online information work for everyone. This includes addressing accessibility needs for people who are blind or low vision. City departments will work together to meet new federal requirements for accessible websites and digital tools. * **Plain Language** – The Mayor’s Office will create Seattle's first plain language plan. This means writing information in a way that is simple, clear, and easy to understand. By using plain language, the City can make programs, services, and emergency updates more accessible to everyone. It will also speed up translations into Seattle’s many spoken languages and make them more affordable. * **Coordinated Communications** – The Innovation and Performance team will review communication platforms and tools across all City departments. This will include finding overlaps or gaps and identifying ways to improve. The goal is to improve public communication systems so everyone can find the information they need quickly and easily.   Read the [Executive Order](https://harrell.seattle.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/23/2025/02/Executive-Order-2025-03-Inclusive-Information.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery). Improving Digital Accessibility In April 2024, the U.S. Department of Justice updated its regulations under Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. This requires state and local governments to make their websites and mobile apps accessible to people with disabilities. The new rule mandates compliance with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 Level AA. This is a standard Seattle had already set as a goal for its City websites. The City will audit its existing websites and content, address accessibility issues, and establish processes for ongoing compliance.  "I appreciate Mayor Harrell and the City of Seattle making this strong commitment to accessibility and inclusion,” **said Marci Carpenter, President, National Federation of the Blind of Washington**. “As a member and leader in the National Federation of the Blind I have urged the federal government to adopt the digital accessibility regulations. I am also excited about the potential of the FIFA Games to help bring awareness of the benefits of accessibility in all areas.” Expanding Language Access There are more than 150 languages or dialects spoken by students and their families in Seattle. In the summer of 2026, Seattle will host six FIFA World Cup matches at Lumen Field. This will bring hundreds of thousands of fans from around the world, including many with limited English. The Office of Immigrant and Refugee Affairs leads the City’s [language access](https://seattle.gov/iandraffairs/LA?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery) efforts, including the Smartcat translation platform.  "Soccer unites and excites, and on behalf of the Seattle FIFA World Cup Local Organizing Committee (SeattleFWC26), I am grateful for Mayor Harrell’s commitment to inclusivity and accessibility for all, including those with disabilities or individuals who speak limited English. This commitment to accessibility truly embodies the spirit of Seattle and is another reason this city is such an incredible place to live, work, and play,” said **Peter Tomozawa**, **CEO Seattle FWC26**. “At SeattleFWC26, we are committed to bringing the World Cup experience to everyone and it is truly inspiring to see our city government embrace the same approach - ensuring equal access, both on and off the pitch, embraces the spirit of Seattle that makes it such an incredible place to live." Clear Communication Plain language, defined by the Federal Plain Language Act of 2010, is writing that is clear, concise, and well-organized. Using plain language makes information easy for the intended audience to understand immediately. The City will create a writing style guide, conduct training, and explore new tools like artificial intelligence to update content.  The modern plain language movement in government began with a 1998 Executive Memorandum by President Bill Clinton, directing federal agencies to [use plain language](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/WCPD-1998-06-08/pdf/WCPD-1998-06-08-Pg1010.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery) so that public communications were clearer and more accessible. In 2023, Governor Jay Inslee issued Washington State’s most recent [Executive Order on plain language](https://governor.wa.gov/sites/default/files/exe_order/23-02%20-%20Plain%20Language.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery). This is Seattle’s first Executive Order requiring plain language, aligning with Mayor Harrell’s [2023 Executive Order](https://harrell.seattle.gov/2023/02/01/mayor-harrell-signs-executive-order-supporting-culturally-responsive-victim-and-family-support-services-for-immigrant-and-refugee-families/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery) to improve crisis response for immigrant and refugee families. This also builds on a [2017 Executive Order](https://www.seattle.gov/Documents/Departments/Mayor/Burgess-Executive-Order-2017-10-Language-Access.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery) to enhance language access as part of Seattle’s commitment to being a welcoming city. What People Are Saying **Rob Lloyd, Chief Technology Officer, City of Seattle**  “Technology helps overcome barriers to city services for our residents who speak other languages, or who live with disabilities. This Executive Order keeps with Seattle values that all residents matter. Clear communication and designing websites and applications through accessible practices shows our commitment, strengthening our relationships with residents and visitors to our beautiful city.”  **Leah Tivoli, Director for Innovation and Performance, City of Seattle**  "I am incredibly excited to collaborate with City partners to create the first comprehensive inventory and evaluation of our communications tools. Together, we are poised to transform how Seattle communicates, ensuring that every resident, worker, and visitor can easily access and understand our information and services as well as opportunities for civic engagement. This initiative paves the way for a more connected and informed Seattle."  **Sam Read, Deputy Director of Department of Neighborhoods, City of Seattle**  “Prioritizing plain language is important as it ensures that everyone, regardless of their background or literacy level, can access and understand city information. This is at the heart of the City of Seattle Community Liaisons Program, which acts as a bridge between government and historically underrepresented and underserved communities. Our Community Liaisons use plain language to help members of their community understand how to participate in government and feel included.”  **Leslie Morishita, Executive Director, InterimCDA**  “We work with hundreds of seniors and community members with limited English in the CID and beyond, and when information from the city is mistranslated or is difficult to translate it creates real obstacles for people to access the services they need and to participate in a meaningful way, in processes that directly impact their lives.  Simplifying the language used in city communication will be immensely valuable and we appreciate Mayor Harrell taking the initiative to do this.”  **Brittny Goodsell, Plain Language Expert**, **State of Washington**  "The City of Seattle's initiative to bring plain language front and center will completely transform the city's work. These writing and design strategies not only improve how well someone can access important information they need to live their lives, but clear writing increases information equity. This practice is always a win, always a home run. And, government entities serve the people of Washington better when they make clear and simple messaging the standard – not the exception. I applaud the mayor's decision to make plain language a priority."  **Alison Cardinal, Ph.D., Assistant Professor Writing Studies, University of Washington**  “Language access is not only a fundamental right established by the Civil Rights Act, it’s also a powerful way to address historical injustices. The Mayor’s affirmation of the City of Seattle’s commitment to language access demonstrates Seattle’s dedication to equity for all residents, regardless of language or disability. By considering the needs and preferences of these communities the beginning, not the end, of any communication strategy, the City ensures that all of its residents, regardless of their background, have equal access to the opportunities for their communities to thrive.”    ### | | |

This also builds on a [2017 Executive Order](https://www.seattle.gov/Documents/Departments/Mayor/Burgess-Executive-Order-2017-10-Language-Access.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery) to enhance language access as part of Seattle’s commitment to being a welcoming city. What People Are Saying **Rob Lloyd, Chief Technology Officer, City of Seattle**  “Technology helps overcome barriers to city services for our residents who speak other languages, or who live with disabilities. This Executive Order keeps with Seattle values that all residents matter. Clear communication and designing websites and applications through accessible practices shows our commitment, strengthening our relationships with residents and visitors to our beautiful city.”  **Leah Tivoli, Director for Innovation and Performance, City of Seattle**  "I am incredibly excited to collaborate with City partners to create the first comprehensive inventory and evaluation of our communications tools. Together, we are poised to transform how Seattle communicates, ensuring that every resident, worker, and visitor can easily access and understand our information and services as well as opportunities for civic engagement. This initiative paves the way for a more connected and informed Seattle."  **Sam Read, Deputy Director of Department of Neighborhoods, City of Seattle**  “Prioritizing plain language is important as it ensures that everyone, regardless of their background or literacy level, can access and understand city information. This is at the heart of the City of Seattle Community Liaisons Program, which acts as a bridge between government and historically underrepresented and underserved communities. Our Community Liaisons use plain language to help members of their community understand how to participate in government and feel included.”  **Leslie Morishita, Executive Director, InterimCDA**  “We work with hundreds of seniors and community members with limited English in the CID and beyond, and when information from the city is mistranslated or is difficult to translate it creates real obstacles for people to access the services they need and to participate in a meaningful way, in processes that directly impact their lives.  Simplifying the language used in city communication will be immensely valuable and we appreciate Mayor Harrell taking the initiative to do this.”  **Brittny Goodsell, Plain Language Expert**, **State of Washington**  "The City of Seattle's initiative to bring plain language front and center will completely transform the city's work. These writing and design strategies not only improve how well someone can access important information they need to live their lives, but clear writing increases information equity. This practice is always a win, always a home run. And, government entities serve the people of Washington better when they make clear and simple messaging the standard – not the exception. I applaud the mayor's decision to make plain language a priority."  **Alison Cardinal, Ph.D., Assistant Professor Writing Studies, University of Washington**  “Language access is not only a fundamental right established by the Civil Rights Act, it’s also a powerful way to address historical injustices. The Mayor’s affirmation of the City of Seattle’s commitment to language access demonstrates Seattle’s dedication to equity for all residents, regardless of language or disability. By considering the needs and preferences of these communities the beginning, not the end, of any communication strategy, the City ensures that all of its residents, regardless of their background, have equal access to the opportunities for their communities to thrive.”    ### | |

The strategy includes the creation of the Seattle’s first plain language plan and new approaches to make information and services more accessible to everyone, including people with disabilities and those with limited English. The strategy will support new federal accessibility standards and help prepare the city for the FIFA World Cup in 2026 when Seattle will welcome fans from all over the world.  “Clear and accessible public information is a core responsibility of government. Whether it’s emergency updates, navigation around town, resources to help people pay a bill or start a business, or news on a neighborhood program, this effort will make it easier for people to get the information they need to use City services,” said **Mayor Harrell**. “Our administration is committed to advancing good governance and meeting people where they are. Too often, dense, difficult, and frankly indecipherable language can be a barrier to accessing government services. As a City, we can and must do better to reach all of our communities.”  The Executive Order launches three different projects as part of the One Seattle Community Communications Strategy:   * **Digital Accessibility** – The City’s Information Technology department will lead efforts to ensure that digital communications and online information work for everyone. This includes addressing accessibility needs for people who are blind or low vision. City departments will work together to meet new federal requirements for accessible websites and digital tools. * **Plain Language** – The Mayor’s Office will create Seattle's first plain language plan. This means writing information in a way that is simple, clear, and easy to understand. By using plain language, the City can make programs, services, and emergency updates more accessible to everyone. It will also speed up translations into Seattle’s many spoken languages and make them more affordable. * **Coordinated Communications** – The Innovation and Performance team will review communication platforms and tools across all City departments. This will include finding overlaps or gaps and identifying ways to improve. The goal is to improve public communication systems so everyone can find the information they need quickly and easily. ![](http://content.govdelivery.com/attachments/fancy_images/WASEATTLE/2017/10/1592504/press-divider_original.jpg)

# Mayor Harrell Issues Executive Order to Improve the Accessibility of City Resources and Information

**Seattle**– Today, Mayor Bruce Harrell issued an Executive Order to improve accessibility of information through a One Seattle Community Communications Strategy. The strategy includes the creation of the Seattle’s first plain language plan and new approaches to make information and services more accessible to everyone, including people with disabilities and those with limited English. The strategy will support new federal accessibility standards and help prepare the city for the FIFA World Cup in 2026 when Seattle will welcome fans from all over the world.

“Clear and accessible public information is a core responsibility of government. Whether it’s emergency updates, navigation around town, resources to help people pay a bill or start a business, or news on a neighborhood program, this effort will make it easier for people to get the information they need to use City services,” said **Mayor Harrell**. “Our administration is committed to advancing good governance and meeting people where they are. Too often, dense, difficult, and frankly indecipherable language can be a barrier to accessing government services. As a City, we can and must do better to reach all of our communities.”

The Executive Order launches three different projects as part of the One Seattle Community Communications Strategy:

Read the [Executive Order](https://harrell.seattle.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/23/2025/02/Executive-Order-2025-03-Inclusive-Information.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery).

## Improving Digital Accessibility

In April 2024, the U.S. Department of Justice updated its regulations under Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. This requires state and local governments to make their websites and mobile apps accessible to people with disabilities. The new rule mandates compliance with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 Level AA. This is a standard Seattle had already set as a goal for its City websites. The City will audit its existing websites and content, address accessibility issues, and establish processes for ongoing compliance.

"I appreciate Mayor Harrell and the City of Seattle making this strong commitment to accessibility and inclusion,” **said Marci Carpenter, President, National Federation of the Blind of Washington**. “As a member and leader in the National Federation of the Blind I have urged the federal government to adopt the digital accessibility regulations. I am also excited about the potential of the FIFA Games to help bring awareness of the benefits of accessibility in all areas.”

## Expanding Language Access

There are more than 150 languages or dialects spoken by students and their families in Seattle. In the summer of 2026, Seattle will host six FIFA World Cup matches at Lumen Field. This will bring hundreds of thousands of fans from around the world, including many with limited English. The Office of Immigrant and Refugee Affairs leads the City’s [language access](https://seattle.gov/iandraffairs/LA?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery) efforts, including the Smartcat translation platform.

"Soccer unites and excites, and on behalf of the Seattle FIFA World Cup Local Organizing Committee (SeattleFWC26), I am grateful for Mayor Harrell’s commitment to inclusivity and accessibility for all, including those with disabilities or individuals who speak limited English. This commitment to accessibility truly embodies the spirit of Seattle and is another reason this city is such an incredible place to live, work, and play,” said **Peter Tomozawa**, **CEO Seattle FWC26**. “At SeattleFWC26, we are committed to bringing the World Cup experience to everyone and it is truly inspiring to see our city government embrace the same approach - ensuring equal access, both on and off the pitch, embraces the spirit of Seattle that makes it such an incredible place to live."

## Clear Communication

Plain language, defined by the Federal Plain Language Act of 2010, is writing that is clear, concise, and well-organized. Using plain language makes information easy for the intended audience to understand immediately. The City will create a writing style guide, conduct training, and explore new tools like artificial intelligence to update content.

The modern plain language movement in government began with a 1998 Executive Memorandum by President Bill Clinton, directing federal agencies to [use plain language](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/WCPD-1998-06-08/pdf/WCPD-1998-06-08-Pg1010.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery) so that public communications were clearer and more accessible. In 2023, Governor Jay Inslee issued Washington State’s most recent [Executive Order on plain language](https://governor.wa.gov/sites/default/files/exe_order/23-02%20-%20Plain%20Language.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery). This is Seattle’s first Executive Order requiring plain language, aligning with Mayor Harrell’s [2023 Executive Order](https://harrell.seattle.gov/2023/02/01/mayor-harrell-signs-executive-order-supporting-culturally-responsive-victim-and-family-support-services-for-immigrant-and-refugee-families/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery) to improve crisis response for immigrant and refugee families. This also builds on a [2017 Executive Order](https://www.seattle.gov/Documents/Departments/Mayor/Burgess-Executive-Order-2017-10-Language-Access.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery) to enhance language access as part of Seattle’s commitment to being a welcoming city.

## What People Are Saying

**Rob Lloyd, Chief Technology Officer, City of Seattle**

“Technology helps overcome barriers to city services for our residents who speak other languages, or who live with disabilities. This Executive Order keeps with Seattle values that all residents matter. Clear communication and designing websites and applications through accessible practices shows our commitment, strengthening our relationships with residents and visitors to our beautiful city.”

**Leah Tivoli, Director for Innovation and Performance, City of Seattle**

"I am incredibly excited to collaborate with City partners to create the first comprehensive inventory and evaluation of our communications tools. Together, we are poised to transform how Seattle communicates, ensuring that every resident, worker, and visitor can easily access and understand our information and services as well as opportunities for civic engagement. This initiative paves the way for a more connected and informed Seattle."

**Sam Read, Deputy Director of Department of Neighborhoods, City of Seattle**

“Prioritizing plain language is important as it ensures that everyone, regardless of their background or literacy level, can access and understand city information. This is at the heart of the City of Seattle Community Liaisons Program, which acts as a bridge between government and historically underrepresented and underserved communities. Our Community Liaisons use plain language to help members of their community understand how to participate in government and feel included.”

**Leslie Morishita, Executive Director, InterimCDA**

“We work with hundreds of seniors and community members with limited English in the CID and beyond, and when information from the city is mistranslated or is difficult to translate it creates real obstacles for people to access the services they need and to participate in a meaningful way, in processes that directly impact their lives.  Simplifying the language used in city communication will be immensely valuable and we appreciate Mayor Harrell taking the initiative to do this.”

**Brittny Goodsell, Plain Language Expert**, **State of Washington**

"The City of Seattle's initiative to bring plain language front and center will completely transform the city's work. These writing and design strategies not only improve how well someone can access important information they need to live their lives, but clear writing increases information equity. This practice is always a win, always a home run. And, government entities serve the people of Washington better when they make clear and simple messaging the standard – not the exception. I applaud the mayor's decision to make plain language a priority."

**Alison Cardinal, Ph.D., Assistant Professor Writing Studies, University of Washington**

“Language access is not only a fundamental right established by the Civil Rights Act, it’s also a powerful way to address historical injustices. The Mayor’s affirmation of the City of Seattle’s commitment to language access demonstrates Seattle’s dedication to equity for all residents, regardless of language or disability. By considering the needs and preferences of these communities the beginning, not the end, of any communication strategy, the City ensures that all of its residents, regardless of their background, have equal access to the opportunities for their communities to thrive.”

summary:
1. Brief Overview:
The content consists of press releases from the Office of the Mayor of Seattle, Bruce Harrell, highlighting various legislative initiatives and funding proposals aimed at improving social, environmental, and public health outcomes in Seattle.

2. Key Points from Each URL: 
- https://harrell.seattle.gov/2025/03/05/mayor-harrell-proposes-legislation-to-strengthen-local-protections-for-people-seeking-gender-affirming-and-reproductive-health-care-in-seattle/
  Mayor Harrell announced legislation to strengthen protections and ensure access to gender-affirming and reproductive health care in Seattle. The focus is on supporting the LGBTQ+ community and reaffirming Seattle as a safe, welcoming city for all.

- https://harrell.seattle.gov/2024/08/14/mayor-harrell-directs-2-6m-to-expand-substance-use-disorder-detox-and-treatment-beds/
  Mayor Harrell directed $2.85 million for expanding detoxification and inpatient treatment bed capacity for people with substance use disorder. The funding supports Valley Cities Recovery Place and addresses opioid settlement funding.

- https://harrell.seattle.gov/2024/07/02/mayor-harrell-advances-legislation-establishing-shore-power-agreement-with-port-of-seattle-for-pier-66/
  Legislation was advanced to authorize Seattle City Light to enter into an agreement with the Port of Seattle to provide shore power at Pier 66. This makes Seattle one of the first cruise ports to offer shore power at every berth, reducing port-related air emissions.

- https://harrell.seattle.gov/2024/03/28/mayor-harrell-proposes-legislation-to-fill-vacant-storefronts-in-downtown-belltown-south-lake-union-and-uptown-through-expanded-uses/
  Proposed legislation aims to fill vacant storefronts in key Seattle neighborhoods like Downtown, Belltown, South Lake Union, and Uptown by removing regulatory barriers and expanding allowable uses to activate street environments and support local businesses.

3. Notable Patterns or Themes:
- Strong emphasis on social equity, specifically supporting marginalized communities such as LGBTQ+ individuals.
- Investment and legislative focus on health care access, substance use disorder treatment, and public health.
- Environmental sustainability with initiatives to reduce air emissions through shore power.
- Urban revitalization through efforts to address vacant commercial spaces and improve economic vitality in key city areas.
  
Overall, the press releases reflect Mayor Harrell's multifaceted approach to fostering an inclusive, healthy, and sustainable Seattle.

summary:
Here is a concise summary of the provided web content from Y Combinator's jobs page for Seattle-based startups:

1. Brief Overview:
The page features job opportunities at Y Combinator-backed startups located in Seattle, highlighting a variety of roles available across multiple domains such as software engineering, product management, design, recruiting, sales, marketing, operations, and science. It emphasizes that these startups are fast-growing and well-funded, encouraging potential candidates to create profiles to connect directly with founders.

2. Key Points:
- The page serves as a centralized hub for startup jobs in Seattle associated with Y Combinator.
- Job roles listed include but are not limited to Software Engineer, Product Manager, Design/UI/UX, Recruiting & HR, Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Science.
- Users can create free profiles on the platform which allows direct contact from founders.
- The content links to specific job role categories, such as software engineering or marketing in Seattle.
- The page mentions Gordian Software (part of the W19 batch), a startup focused on building software to reduce friction in travel, indicative of the types of innovative companies featured.
- Additional resources and links related to Y Combinator such as the YC interview guide, startup directory, and YC blog are available for users seeking more information.

3. Notable Patterns or Themes:
- Emphasis on direct founder-to-candidate connections, bypassing traditional job application processes.
- Focused on tech and startup ecosystem roles, aligning with Y Combinator’s mission to foster innovation.
- Multiple job categories are offered, reflecting a broad range of functions required in scaling startups.
- The page positions Seattle as a growing hub for Y Combinator startups.
- Integration with Y Combinator’s broader resources such as educational content, founder matching, and investor information, supporting startups beyond just hiring.

In summary, this Y Combinator web page acts as a key resource for finding diverse tech-related startup jobs in Seattle, promoting an innovative, founder-focused hiring approach backed by YC’s extensive startup ecosystem.

summary:
1. Overview:
The analyzed content is from Y Combinator's job listing page specifically focused on startups in Seattle. It provides a comprehensive resource for job seekers interested in joining fast-growing YC-backed startups in Seattle, highlighting various roles and recent hires.

2. Key Points:
- The page is hosted by Y Combinator, a renowned startup accelerator.
- It offers direct job listings from YC startups in Seattle with a wide range of roles such as Software Engineering, Product Management, Design, Recruiting & HR, Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Science.
- Job seekers can create a profile for free to connect directly with startup founders.
- The content emphasizes the dynamic and well-funded nature of YC startups in Seattle, signaling strong hiring momentum.
- Specific roles are linked for easy navigation, including software engineer, product manager, designer, and more.
- Recent job additions in Seattle span multiple disciplines, reflecting diverse opportunities.
- The site also promotes YC community resources like the YC Interview Guide, Startup Jobs Blog, and co-founder matching services.
- An example startup listed is Gordian Software, known for building travel-related software to reduce friction.
- The page encourages applications for the next YC batch (F2025), indicating ongoing startup growth and new opportunities.

3. Notable Patterns/Themes:
- Focus on Seattle as a key hub for YC startups hiring across varied roles.
- Strong emphasis on direct founder connections and creating profiles to facilitate that.
- Broad role categories reflecting the varied needs of scaling startups.
- Integration with YC’s broader ecosystem resources to support job seekers and founders.
- Highlight on community and continuous growth with upcoming YC batch recruitment.

In summary, this is a highly specialized, startup-centric job board tailored for tech and operational roles in Seattle YC startups, emphasizing direct founder engagement and leveraging the YC startup ecosystem.

## Subsplash

👥 100 - 500 employees

Subsplash is an innovation leader in Fintech and mobile SaaS. We are blessed with a team of smart, fun, laser-focused people and we’re glad that you're here exploring opportunities with us! As a design-centric company, we are dedicated to creating software experiences that inspire and delight our clients as well as the real people that use our apps everyday.
An Award-Winning Team:
- Puget Sound Business Journal's Washington's Best Workplaces in 2018 and 2019
- Seattle Business Magazine's 100 Best Companies to Work For 2019 & 2020
- Austin Business Journal's Best Places to Work 2020
- Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies
Our core values:
Drive for Humility, Innovation, and Excellence. We use these values to help determine our decisions and actions and to measure our success.
Humility
Humility is the key to collaborative creativity. In addition, we are designing for people who are engendered with dignity, value and respect. This drives our philosophy of people-centered design.
Innovation
We believe God made people in His image and likeness. Because of this we are built to be creative - bringing order out of chaos. Subsplash takes this seriously, so we constantly seek to push the boundaries and pursue new successes. We love to look closely, draw, think, design, critique, code, animate, experiment, write, explore, research, build, test, consult, create, and envision. We do all this for the purpose of honoring God and serving people.
Excellence
We love creating software experiences that inspire and delight. We work with forward-looking organizations to create great brands and experiences. We strive to work with care and intense attention to detail. We want our impact on the world to be lasting and meaningful in a way that ultimately points to Jesus Christ.

Summary:

1. Overview:
The web content is a collection of tech and startup job listings in Seattle, WA, primarily hosted on the Built In Seattle platform. The listings feature a variety of roles across multiple companies, showcasing opportunities predominantly in technology, operations, communications, and engineering sectors.

2. Key Points:
- Built In Seattle hosts job listings for top tech positions and startup jobs.
- Companies featured include CoreWeave, Remitly, Snap Inc., Atlassian, Chewy, John Deere, SoFi, Anduril, and Qualtrics.
- Job roles vary widely:
  - CoreWeave: People Operations Partner, Vice President of Global Communications, Vice President of Brand Strategy.
  - Remitly: Manager, Operations Analytics, Reconciliation.
  - Snap Inc.: Senior Principal Machine Learning Engineer (ML Platform), Staff Software Engineer (ML Infrastructure), Product Manager (Content Quality).
  - Atlassian: Principal Data Scientist in AI.
  - Chewy: Software Engineer II.
  - John Deere: Senior Embedded Security Engineer.
  - SoFi: Senior Staff Engineer, Cloud Platform.
  - Anduril: Senior Robotics Software Engineer (UAV), Security Engineer (Mergers & Acquisitions).
- The roles emphasize advanced technical expertise, leadership in operations and communications, and specialization in AI, machine learning, cloud platforms, robotics, and security.

3. Notable Patterns/Themes:
- Strong focus on technology-driven roles, especially in AI, machine learning, and cloud computing.
- Presence of senior-level and leadership positions, indicating opportunities for experienced professionals.
- Companies represented are a mix of established tech firms (e.g., Snap Inc., Atlassian, John Deere) and innovative startups or growth companies.
- Roles span various functional areas including tech development, operations analytics, brand strategy, and communications.
- The Seattle job market is highlighted as dynamic and tech-centric with varied opportunities spanning from engineering to executive leadership.

results.raw_content:
# Join our team

Interested in building the safe source for open source? Belting it out at karaoke with our engineering team? Enjoying a Chipotle burrito bowl with our CEO? Talking nerdy to us? Then you’ve come to the right place.

![Several chainguardians posing for a photo at a company summit.](/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F3t3coCYhGNfcflPzYUicgV%2Ffe052c813563a0bcbd7bbf8b8bed0eed%2Fcareers_pg_hero_img.png&w=3840&q=75)

We're building a future where security and innovation move in lockstep and every line of code makes software safer, not more vulnerable.

Chainguard is blending unprecedented growth with bold moves. Backed by legendary investors and co-founded by open source pioneers, we’re securing the future of software development and deployment.

At Chainguard, everyone is motivated to make an impact, challenged to run towards difficult, and rewarded for crushing their goals — and we have a blast while doing it.

![](/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F5TtTl4Ns7heALDy3htCRj7%2F4f754ba355aefbff849811a1f6c5c17e%2Fcg_in_person_2.png&w=3840&q=75)
![](/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F5KqvB4J9EEGJBupIKAsEkS%2F8fc6b40f789332f920615a1ac78a6cc0%2F204-DSC09461.jpg&w=3840&q=75)
![](/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F1mOhPEjudrLoGto68OoPW4%2F8c53e518866e18bc4250afc439cbe828%2Fimage__8_.png&w=3840&q=75)
![](/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F1uYWVmG7ZViDtzE4TFSt4o%2Ff1f66391365e6bb7ce0e8928ec3bba92%2Fcg_in_person_4.png&w=3840&q=75)
![](/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F5TtTl4Ns7heALDy3htCRj7%2F4f754ba355aefbff849811a1f6c5c17e%2Fcg_in_person_2.png&w=3840&q=75)
![](/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F5KqvB4J9EEGJBupIKAsEkS%2F8fc6b40f789332f920615a1ac78a6cc0%2F204-DSC09461.jpg&w=3840&q=75)
![](/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F1mOhPEjudrLoGto68OoPW4%2F8c53e518866e18bc4250afc439cbe828%2Fimage__8_.png&w=3840&q=75)
![](/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F1uYWVmG7ZViDtzE4TFSt4o%2Ff1f66391365e6bb7ce0e8928ec3bba92%2Fcg_in_person_4.png&w=3840&q=75)

## Our culture & values

Authentic, collaborative, inclusive, bold, and fun—that’s how we roll.

![A star icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/1yaVHdOYvmIlSW3PvwszBY/7dee8db90fb3d76fa8e481d0110e4248/purple_star_icon.svg)

### Customer obsessed

We're obsessed with making our customers' lives easier and their software supply chains safer.

![A right arrow icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/ivatLpTPFU9VELjszF7HT/893b63c9a39b797b4c8d07554d74fec9/purple_right_arrow_icon.svg)

### Bias for intentional action

We prioritize, plan, test, fail, learn, and grow.

![A cool Linky icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/5VC0gYXimM9N8YU5ueLLlM/71da0443d4eae1123dd0caaba0bf5311/purple_cool_linky_icon.svg)

### We do serious work, but don't take ourselves too seriously

Serious about our mission, playful about everything else.

![A users icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/620X2PH9ajRwTDqUBwRk5r/e1d65b103fda511bd9c16e1e1dbac136/purple_users_icon.svg)

### Trust each other and assume good intentions

Good intentions are our default setting. It's how we build a team that's supportive, collaborative, and fun.

## We take care of one another

We value every Chainguardian who chooses to join us on this journey and our benefits are how we say “thank you.” Here are a few of the many perks of working at Chainguard:

![A globe icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/Mw1yxXgJq3UVnx2nCkacR/832b898d4086719cda946e45fec922d9/purple_globe_icon.svg)

### Flexible & Remote-First Culture

Imagine working with 500 people you’ve never met in person! Don’t worry — we make it easy with team meetup opportunities, bi-annual destination summits, and a monthly stipend for coworking spaces. We even cover your phone and internet costs.

![A cross icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/Fr1pedWbeA4qn6rW2bOi8/d151a93b068be26141f782e4bb154521/purple_cross_icon.svg)

### 100% Covered Health Insurance

100% coverage for health, vision, and dental — for you and your dependents. Yes, really. No fine print. No payroll deductions. Just excellent care, totally on us.

![](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/1iz82mtWo1paP3hgupXXGh/7a95513d66e79bec0d50e9dc9cda608e/purple_heart_icon.svg)

### 18 Weeks Paid Parental Leave

New kid on the block? We’ve got you. All new parents get 12 weeks of paid bonding leave. Birthing parents? Add another 6 weeks for recovery (because, you know, childbirth). You focus on your growing family — we’ll handle the grown-up logistics.

![A grid icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/38vIdH0cR1Jtxabsmjfdgw/060fda1a2de169e437b69f098ac02cb3/purple_grid_icon.svg)

### Our Approach to Equity

Chainguard is a team sport and you’re a part-owner. We grant stock options at hire and promotion, and (brace yourself) you’ll have 10 whole years to exercise them. 10 years!

![A sun icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/6y0iYBO1hVh20s9RVRx7bb/828770a2d4837a4595441140fa67da09/purple_sun_icon.svg)

### $300 Monthly Wellness Perk

Health is wealth! Spend your wellness stipend on a wide variety of things like gym memberships, massages, food delivery and more.

![](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/14qBSknwwuJtPTVclhaDUf/4e914bd14aa091ff43a32c08193627fb/purple_family_icon.svg)

### $18,000 Family Planning Support

Whether your path to parenthood includes adoption, IVF, egg freezing, or surrogacy — we’re here to support. We offer this lifetime reimbursement to help you grow your family, your way.

![A desktop icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/3ZmHSqmvJ89G2DIzsvaOZ7/0e8e47fecace03223fdfbb14fcb21bb5/purple_tv_icon.svg)

### $1,750 Home Office Setup

Design your own comfortable WFH space. Set up your remote work environment with a one-time home office budget upon joining!

![A map icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/4bXH8SPpG0mrYzyXNkvCcz/9f51cef2ca06eaddc1fc91cc01d60e03/purple_map_icon.svg)

### Flexible Time Off

We all need to recharge, so take the time you need. Whether you're off to conquer a mountain or a Netflix marathon from your couch, time off is key to doing your best work and being your best self.

![A trophy icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/4x0VqA7UFFOBPnv8PyIFLM/d9f0a2b50d94445cd701419785025070/purple_trophy_icon.svg)

### Up to $3,000 in peer spot bonuses annually

See someone crushing it? Recognize fellow Chainguardians for their hard work — and get recognized for yours!

## Remote-first. People-centric.

![](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/7sirmO6xjU2YMdxcwY0Dqz/551ce3a42626193d4d770f8efb02f29e/Ireland.svg)

### Ireland Site Visit

Go for a swim, enjoy a moment in the forest, and grab a pint of Guinness with our team in Ireland.

![](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/WNbdKzyQwJMe9fSznKVJ4/8cd485651b83b4ea957780dfc4b4e185/san-francisco.svg)

### San Francisco Site Visit

Welcome to the Full (Guard) House. Everywhere you look, everywhere you go, there's a Chainguardian, a teammate to support you.

![](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/3NVxlgWLUu2GhfhnE80O96/bca96ffde82213b6b7353da8e495842b/colorado-visit.svg)

### Colorado Site Visit

People have a lot of misconceptions about Colorado. Our team of bikers, skiers, and microbrewery enthusiasts tries to dispel them.

## We’re looking for you

Are you:

You're ready to become a Chainguardian!

We want to hear from you!

## Build the future with us

## Subsplash

👥 100 - 500 employees

🏢 Seattle, WA

🌱 Company founded in 2005

💰 Total funding to date

Subsplash is an innovation leader in Fintech and mobile SaaS. We are blessed with a team of smart, fun, laser-focused people and we’re glad that you're here exploring opportunities with us! As a design-centric company, we are dedicated to creating software experiences that inspire and delight our clients as well as the real people that use our apps everyday.
An Award-Winning Team:
- Puget Sound Business Journal's Washington's Best Workplaces in 2018 and 2019
- Seattle Business Magazine's 100 Best Companies to Work For 2019 & 2020
- Austin Business Journal's Best Places to Work 2020
- Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies
Our core values:
Drive for Humility, Innovation, and Excellence. We use these values to help determine our decisions and actions and to measure our success.
Humility
Humility is the key to collaborative creativity. In addition, we are designing for people who are engendered with dignity, value and respect. This drives our philosophy of people-centered design.
Innovation
We believe God made people in His image and likeness. Because of this we are built to be creative - bringing order out of chaos. Subsplash takes this seriously, so we constantly seek to push the boundaries and pursue new successes. We love to look closely, draw, think, design, critique, code, animate, experiment, write, explore, research, build, test, consult, create, and envision. We do all this for the purpose of honoring God and serving people.
Excellence
We love creating software experiences that inspire and delight. We work with forward-looking organizations to create great brands and experiences. We strive to work with care and intense attention to detail. We want our impact on the world to be lasting and meaningful in a way that ultimately points to Jesus Christ.

## Netskope

👥 1,000 - 5,000 employees

🏢 Santa Clara, CA

🌱 Company founded in 2012

💰 Total funding to date $1,441,100,032

Netskope is an American software company providing a computer security platform. The platform offers cloud-native solutions to businesses for data protection and defense against threats in cloud applications, cloud infrastructure, and the web. Netskope is considered a "leader in its field" status for its Cloud Access Security Brokers (CASB) product from Gartner.

summary:
**Summary of Job Opportunities at Top Y Combinator Startups in Seattle**

1. **Key Findings Relevant to User's Request:**
- Seattle hosts a vibrant ecosystem of fast-growing startups backed by Y Combinator, offering numerous job opportunities.
- Job roles available are diverse, specifically including Software Engineer, Product Manager, Design/UI/UX, Recruiting & HR, Sales Manager, Marketing, Operations, and Science.
- New job listings are frequently added in these roles, indicating active hiring.
- Startups like Gordian Software (W19 batch) are examples of companies currently hiring in Seattle, focusing on innovative software solutions for travel.

2. **Actionable Insights:**
- To explore these opportunities, creating a profile on the Y Combinator startup job platform is recommended. Founders actively reach out to candidates who have profiles.
- Job seekers should monitor the roles mentioned above as they exhibit frequent openings in Seattle.
- Tailor applications to these core functions to tap into the current demand trends.

3. **Monitoring Recommendations:**
- Regularly check Y Combinator's jobs page for Seattle to catch new postings for targeted roles.
- Follow companies in the YC network, especially those in the recent and upcoming batches, for fresh hiring sprees.
- Keep an eye on changes in role availability and new companies entering the Seattle startup space within the YC accelerator.

4. **Notable Patterns:**
- Hiring across a broad range of roles beyond engineering, including creative, operational, and scientific positions, suggests startups are expanding diverse teams.
- The YC platform offers a direct founder-to-candidate connection, streamlining the recruitment process.
- The focus on software and technology-driven roles indicates Seattle's ongoing growth as a tech startup hub.

**Summary:** For job seekers interested in Seattle's top startups, Y Combinator startups present a rich pool of opportunities across various roles. Maintaining awareness of new postings on their job platform, creating a profile to attract founder interest, and following YC startup cohorts will maximize chances of landing a position in this dynamic ecosystem.

===============

[![Image 1: Chainguard Logo](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/7mfPjetfsoRl7FiHaf30MI/871526c452694d6d0b54d6e88ee6909c/chainguard-logo-dark.svg)](https://www.chainguard.dev/)

*   Customers customers [Customer Stories Learn how leading companies are securing their software supply chain.](https://www.chainguard.dev/customers)[Chainguard Reviews Real, unsolicited reviews from Chainguard users.](https://www.chainguard.dev/chainguard-love) featured story [Anoosh Saboori Head of Product Security](https://www.chainguard.dev/customers/securing-trust-in-the-data-cloud-snowflakes-journey-with-chainguard)    
*   Resources learn [Events & Webinars Check out our upcoming virtual and in-person events.](https://www.chainguard.dev/events)[Chainguard Courses Transform your potential into expertise with Chainguard Courses.](https://courses.chainguard.dev/) developers [Documentation Documentation and tutorials to help make your software secure.](https://edu.chainguard.dev/)[Trust Center We are committed to safeguarding our customers' data.](https://security.chainguard.dev/)

[Contact us](https://www.chainguard.dev/contact)

Join our team
=============

Interested in building the safe source for open source? Belting it out at karaoke with our engineering team? Enjoying a Chipotle burrito bowl with our CEO? Talking nerdy to us? Then you’ve come to the right place.

[See open positions](https://www.chainguard.dev/careers#open-positions)

![Image 2: Several chainguardians posing for a photo at a company summit.](https://www.chainguard.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F3t3coCYhGNfcflPzYUicgV%2Ffe052c813563a0bcbd7bbf8b8bed0eed%2Fcareers_pg_hero_img.png&w=3840&q=75)

We're building a future where security and innovation move in lockstep and every line of code makes software safer, not more vulnerable.

Chainguard is blending unprecedented growth with bold moves. Backed by legendary investors and co-founded by open source pioneers, we’re securing the future of software development and deployment.

At Chainguard, everyone is motivated to make an impact, challenged to run towards difficult, and rewarded for crushing their goals — and we have a blast while doing it.

*   ![Image 3](https://www.chainguard.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F5TtTl4Ns7heALDy3htCRj7%2F4f754ba355aefbff849811a1f6c5c17e%2Fcg_in_person_2.png&w=3840&q=75)
*   ![Image 4](https://www.chainguard.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F5KqvB4J9EEGJBupIKAsEkS%2F8fc6b40f789332f920615a1ac78a6cc0%2F204-DSC09461.jpg&w=3840&q=75)
*   ![Image 5](https://www.chainguard.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F1mOhPEjudrLoGto68OoPW4%2F8c53e518866e18bc4250afc439cbe828%2Fimage__8_.png&w=3840&q=75)
*   ![Image 6](https://www.chainguard.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F1uYWVmG7ZViDtzE4TFSt4o%2Ff1f66391365e6bb7ce0e8928ec3bba92%2Fcg_in_person_4.png&w=3840&q=75)
*   ![Image 7](https://www.chainguard.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F5TtTl4Ns7heALDy3htCRj7%2F4f754ba355aefbff849811a1f6c5c17e%2Fcg_in_person_2.png&w=3840&q=75)
*   ![Image 8](https://www.chainguard.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F5KqvB4J9EEGJBupIKAsEkS%2F8fc6b40f789332f920615a1ac78a6cc0%2F204-DSC09461.jpg&w=3840&q=75)
*   ![Image 9](https://www.chainguard.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F1mOhPEjudrLoGto68OoPW4%2F8c53e518866e18bc4250afc439cbe828%2Fimage__8_.png&w=3840&q=75)
*   ![Image 10](https://www.chainguard.dev/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.ctfassets.net%2Fl47ir7rfykkn%2F1uYWVmG7ZViDtzE4TFSt4o%2Ff1f66391365e6bb7ce0e8928ec3bba92%2Fcg_in_person_4.png&w=3840&q=75)

Our culture & values
--------------------

Authentic, collaborative, inclusive, bold, and fun—that’s how we roll.

![Image 11: A star icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/1yaVHdOYvmIlSW3PvwszBY/7dee8db90fb3d76fa8e481d0110e4248/purple_star_icon.svg)

### Customer obsessed

We're obsessed with making our customers' lives easier and their software supply chains safer.

[Hear it from our customers directly](https://www.chainguard.dev/customers)

![Image 12: A right arrow icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/ivatLpTPFU9VELjszF7HT/893b63c9a39b797b4c8d07554d74fec9/purple_right_arrow_icon.svg)

### Bias for intentional action

We prioritize, plan, test, fail, learn, and grow.

![Image 13: A cool Linky icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/5VC0gYXimM9N8YU5ueLLlM/71da0443d4eae1123dd0caaba0bf5311/purple_cool_linky_icon.svg)

### We do serious work, but don't take ourselves too seriously

Serious about our mission, playful about everything else.

![Image 14: A users icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/620X2PH9ajRwTDqUBwRk5r/e1d65b103fda511bd9c16e1e1dbac136/purple_users_icon.svg)

### Trust each other and assume good intentions

Good intentions are our default setting. It's how we build a team that's supportive, collaborative, and fun.

We take care of one another
---------------------------

We value every Chainguardian who chooses to join us on this journey and our benefits are how we say “thank you.” Here are a few of the many perks of working at Chainguard:

![Image 15: A globe icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/Mw1yxXgJq3UVnx2nCkacR/832b898d4086719cda946e45fec922d9/purple_globe_icon.svg)

### Flexible & Remote-First Culture

Imagine working with 500 people you’ve never met in person! Don’t worry — we make it easy with team meetup opportunities, bi-annual destination summits, and a monthly stipend for coworking spaces. We even cover your phone and internet costs.

![Image 16: A cross icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/Fr1pedWbeA4qn6rW2bOi8/d151a93b068be26141f782e4bb154521/purple_cross_icon.svg)

### 100% Covered Health Insurance

100% coverage for health, vision, and dental — for you and your dependents. Yes, really. No fine print. No payroll deductions. Just excellent care, totally on us.

![Image 17](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/1iz82mtWo1paP3hgupXXGh/7a95513d66e79bec0d50e9dc9cda608e/purple_heart_icon.svg)

### 18 Weeks Paid Parental Leave

New kid on the block? We’ve got you. All new parents get 12 weeks of paid bonding leave. Birthing parents? Add another 6 weeks for recovery (because, you know, childbirth). You focus on your growing family — we’ll handle the grown-up logistics.

![Image 18: A grid icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/38vIdH0cR1Jtxabsmjfdgw/060fda1a2de169e437b69f098ac02cb3/purple_grid_icon.svg)

### Our Approach to Equity

Chainguard is a team sport and you’re a part-owner. We grant stock options at hire and promotion, and (brace yourself) you’ll have 10 whole years to exercise them. 10 years!

![Image 19: A sun icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/6y0iYBO1hVh20s9RVRx7bb/828770a2d4837a4595441140fa67da09/purple_sun_icon.svg)

### $300 Monthly Wellness Perk

Health is wealth! Spend your wellness stipend on a wide variety of things like gym memberships, massages, food delivery and more.

![Image 20](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/14qBSknwwuJtPTVclhaDUf/4e914bd14aa091ff43a32c08193627fb/purple_family_icon.svg)

### $18,000 Family Planning Support

Whether your path to parenthood includes adoption, IVF, egg freezing, or surrogacy — we’re here to support. We offer this lifetime reimbursement to help you grow your family, your way.

![Image 21: A desktop icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/3ZmHSqmvJ89G2DIzsvaOZ7/0e8e47fecace03223fdfbb14fcb21bb5/purple_tv_icon.svg)

### $1,750 Home Office Setup

Design your own comfortable WFH space. Set up your remote work environment with a one-time home office budget upon joining!

![Image 22: A map icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/4bXH8SPpG0mrYzyXNkvCcz/9f51cef2ca06eaddc1fc91cc01d60e03/purple_map_icon.svg)

### Flexible Time Off

We all need to recharge, so take the time you need. Whether you're off to conquer a mountain or a Netflix marathon from your couch, time off is key to doing your best work and being your best self.

![Image 23: A trophy icon.](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/4x0VqA7UFFOBPnv8PyIFLM/d9f0a2b50d94445cd701419785025070/purple_trophy_icon.svg)

### Up to $3,000 in peer spot bonuses annually

See someone crushing it? Recognize fellow Chainguardians for their hard work — and get recognized for yours!

Remote-first. People-centric.
-----------------------------

[![Image 24](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/7sirmO6xjU2YMdxcwY0Dqz/551ce3a42626193d4d770f8efb02f29e/Ireland.svg) ### Ireland Site Visit Go for a swim, enjoy a moment in the forest, and grab a pint of Guinness with our team in Ireland.](https://youtu.be/hhAReDP2OJk%3Ffeature=shared)[![Image 25](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/WNbdKzyQwJMe9fSznKVJ4/8cd485651b83b4ea957780dfc4b4e185/san-francisco.svg) ### San Francisco Site Visit Welcome to the Full (Guard) House. Everywhere you look, everywhere you go, there's a Chainguardian, a teammate to support you.](https://youtu.be/N0rKNxJVxBk%3Ffeature=shared)[![Image 26](https://images.ctfassets.net/l47ir7rfykkn/3NVxlgWLUu2GhfhnE80O96/bca96ffde82213b6b7353da8e495842b/colorado-visit.svg) ### Colorado Site Visit People have a lot of misconceptions about Colorado. Our team of bikers, skiers, and microbrewery enthusiasts tries to dispel them.](https://youtu.be/52dgZbVkWqs%3Ffeature=shared)

We’re looking for you
---------------------

Are you:

*   Excited by solving never-been-solved problems?
*   At your best in fast-paced, high-performance environments?
*   Someone who takes work and fun seriously?
*   Ready to be part of a world-class team?

You're ready to become a Chainguardian!

We want to hear from you!

[See open positions](https://www.chainguard.dev/careers#open-positions)

Build the future with us
------------------------
